name: playerCount
description: The Number of players participating in the given game.

name: stageDuration
description: Determines how long (in seconds) a stage will last (the default length is 120 seconds).

name: introDuration
description: Determines how long (in seconds) intro steps per task will last (the default length is 120 seconds).

name: outroDuration
description: Determines how long (in seconds) outro steps per task will last (the default length is 120 seconds).

name: networkStructure
description: Who is connected to who: 1-2,1-3,2-5,2-6,... (-1 indicates complete connections)

name: randomizeTask
description: Determines if the task type order will be randomized.

name: randomizeInstance
description: Determines if the task instances order will be randomized.

name: chat
description: Determines whether or not you can chat with your neighbors during the interactive stage.

name: chatGroups
description: Players can be in multiple chat groups (denoted by a letter): 1-A,1-B,2-B,3-B,4-A,... (1 has 2 chat windows, can talk with 2 and 3 in window B, and with 4 in window A). (-1 indicates complete connection)

name: basePay
description: The base amount of money a user will get from completing the experiment.

name: conversionRate
description: The conversion rate of score to bonus dollars paid. When the rate is quarter, this means the user will get $8 if they score 300 points.

name: feedback
description: Determines whether or not the user will be able to have any feedback (ie. outcome stage or score shown).

name: longTermEngagement
description: For conditions that don’t require synchronized gameplay between multiple users/clients; determines whether an additional stage will be added to the end of each round with maximum/infinite duration, allowing users to leave and return to the page at their convenience. This probably only works for “solo”

name: quitEarly
description: If toggled, a subject has the option to skip to the Exit Steps prior to starting a new round

name: subUnits
description: integer value for how many splits there should be

name: unitsSeed
description: seed s.t. split of tasks is the same

name: unitsIndex
description: integer of which split to give a batch [0 to subUnits - 1]
